definitions.definition: to repeat the exact words that another person has said or written
definitions.sensetop: quote somethingquote something from somethingquote from somethingquote somebody/something in somethingquote somebodyquote somebody as doing somethingquote somebody on somethingquote + speech

examples.text: to quote Shakespeare
He quoted a passage from the minister's speech.
They quoted from the Bible.
Quote this reference number in all correspondence.
He was widely quoted in the American media.
The figures quoted in this article refer only to Britain.
Jude is one of three people **quoted in the story**.
to **quote an expert/an official/a source**
The minister claimed he had been selectively quoted.
The President was **quoted** in the press **as saying** that he disagreed with the decision.
She said, and I quote, ‘Life is meaningless without love.’
‘It will all be gone tomorrow.’ ‘**Can I quote you on that?**’
**Don't quote me on this** *(= this is not an official statement)*, but I think he is going to resign.
‘The man who is tired of London is tired of life,’ he quoted.
She quotes extensively from the author's diaries.
They said they were quoting from a recent report.
The passage is quoted in full.
He is wrongly quoted as saying ‘Play it again, Sam.’

definitions.definition: to mention an example of something to support what you are saying

examples.text: Can you quote me an instance of when this happened?
an example that is often quoted as evidence of mismanagement
He quoted one case in which a person had died in a fire.
the most widely quoted and influential study in this field

definitions.definition: to tell a customer how much money you will charge them for a job, service or product
definitions.sensetop: quote somethingquote something for (doing) somethingquote somebody somethingquote somebody something for (doing) something

examples.text: The agent is quoting a guide price of €250 000.
The price they quoted for the kitchen was too high.
A garage quoted him £80.
They quoted us £300 for installing a shower unit.

definitions.definition: to give a market price for shares, gold or foreign money

examples.text: Yesterday the pound was quoted at $1.8285, unchanged from Monday.

definitions.definition: to give the prices for a business company’s shares on a stock exchange

examples.text: Several football clubs are now quoted on the Stock Exchange.
publicly quoted companies

definitions.definition: used to show the beginning (and end) of a word, phrase, etc. that has been said or written by somebody else

examples.text: It was quote, ‘the hardest decision of my life’, unquote, and one that he lived to regret.
now that the, quote, unquote, ‘real story’ has begun

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from medieval Latin quotare, from quot ‘how many’, or from medieval Latin quota. The original sense was ‘mark a book with numbers, or with marginal references’, later ‘give a reference by page or chapter’, hence ‘cite a text or person’ (late 16th cent.).
